conclusion: Two regions with different magnetic field strengths: B1 = 2B2; MN is the interface; particle with charge +q and mass m enters B1 perpendicularly at point O; find when it will pass through point O again, moving downward
Charged particle undergoes circular motion in a uniform magnetic field; radius of circular path is r = mv/qB
Period of circular motion in a magnetic field is T = 2πm/qB
Period for upper region with field B1: T1 = 2πm/qB1
Period for lower region with field B2: T2 = 2πm/qB2
Since B1 = 2B2, T1 = T2/2, meaning T2 = 2T1
Particle enters upper region at point O, moves in semicircular path in upper region, crosses MN into lower region, moves in semicircular path in lower region, returns to point O moving downward
Time for semicircle in upper region (B1): T1/2 = πm/qB1
Time for semicircle in lower region (B2): T2/2 = πm/qB2
Total time = T1/2 + T2/2 = πm/qB1 + πm/qB2 = πm(1/qB1 + 1/qB2)
Substituting B1 = 2B2: Total time = πm(1/2qB2 + 1/qB2) = πm(1 + 2/2qB2) = 3πm/2qB2
Final answer: The time it takes for the particle to pass through point O downward again is 3πm/2qB2
